document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic notes on the Lygephila vulcanea (Butler, 1881) species-group (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Toxocampinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic notes on the Lygephila vulcanea (Butler, 1881) species-group (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Toxocampinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Toxocampa lupina
Graeser, 1890
, Berliner Entomologische Zeitschrift , 35 : 71–84 . (TL: [ Russia , Judish Autonomy, Radde] Raddefka)

Synonymy:
Eccrita mirabilis
Bryk, 1948
, Arkiv för Zoologi 41 ( 1 ): 119 . (TL: N Korea , Shuotsu), syn. rev.

Type material examined.
Holotype : Female (
Fig. 5
), Amur Centr. (Radde), [ 18 ] 87 , ex. coll. Püngeler,

slide No. OP 1931 f (coll. MNHU ); Holotype of
Eccrita mirabilis
Bryk, 1948
(
Fig. 6
): male, Korea , Shuotan, 1935 , Sten Bergman, slide RM prep. 9027 (
Fig. 11
) (coll. NHRS ) (Swedish Museum of Natural History).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
L. lupina
differs from its close relative
L. vulcanea
by its pale ochreous-brown ground colour of forewing, whereas
L. vulcanea
is darker, deep brown to claret-brown, most often with clearly visible violaceous shade. (See under the detailed diagnosis of the previous species).

Wingspan 44–49 mm . Head and body brownish-grey; collar dark chocolate-brown. Forewing ochreous-brown with sparse dark brown irroration; subbasal line indistinct; antemedial line arched, with distinct costal patch; reniform stigma large, dark brown, consists of 5-6 streak-like spots; orbicular stigma absent; postmedial and subterminal lines distinct, their costal patches fused into long dark streak; terminal line a row of black dots. Hindwing brownish; small discal spot present on underside; outer third dark brown; fringes as ground colour.
Distribution. Russian Far East (Primorye terr.), China .
